Class TimeSeriesUtils

java.lang.Object
quacooker.algorithm.stats.TimeSeriesUtils
public class TimeSeriesUtils extends Object
Provides utility functions for time series analysis, including calculations for returns, mean, standard deviation, correlation, percentiles, and more.

  • Method Details

    • pricesToMultiplicativeReturns

      public static ArrayList<Double> pricesToMultiplicativeReturns(ArrayList<Double> prices)
      Converts a list of prices into multiplicative returns using the natural logarithm of the price ratio.
      Parameters:
      prices - A list of prices in chronological order.
      Returns:
      A list of multiplicative returns.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the list of prices contains fewer than two values.

    • calculateMean

      public static double calculateMean(double[] data)
      Calculates the mean of a given data set.
      Parameters:
      data - An array of numerical data.
      Returns:
      The mean (average) of the data.

    • calculateStandardDeviation

      public static double calculateStandardDeviation(double[] data)
      Calculates the standard deviation of a given data set.
      Parameters:
      data - An array of numerical data.
      Returns:
      The standard deviation of the data.

    • calculateCorrelation

      public static double calculateCorrelation(double[] series1, double[] series2)
      Calculates the correlation coefficient between two time series.
      Parameters:
      series1 - The first time series.
      series2 - The second time series.
      Returns:
      The correlation coefficient between the two series.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the series are of different lengths or empty.

    • calculateZScores

      public static double[] calculateZScores(double[] data)
      Calculates the Z-scores of a given data set. (Placeholder method for future implementation.)
      Parameters:
      data - An array of numerical data.
      Returns:
      An array of Z-scores for the data.

    • calculateEMA

      public static double[] calculateEMA(double[] data, int period)
      Calculates the Exponential Moving Average (EMA) of a given data set. (Placeholder method for future implementation.)
      Parameters:
      data - An array of numerical data.
      period - The period for calculating the EMA.
      Returns:
      An array representing the EMA of the data.

    • calculateSMA

      public static double[] calculateSMA(double[] data, int period)
      Calculates the Simple Moving Average (SMA) of a given data set. (Placeholder method for future implementation.)
      Parameters:
      data - An array of numerical data.
      period - The period for calculating the SMA.
      Returns:
      An array representing the SMA of the data.

    • calculatePercentile

      public static double calculatePercentile(ArrayList<Double> values, double percentile)
      Calculates the percentile of a list of values.
      Parameters:
      values - A list of numerical values.
      percentile - The percentile to calculate (between 0 and 100).
      Returns:
      The value at the specified percentile.
